channel.title: Comments on: Working with data in protovis â€“ part 2 of 5

item.title: By: KKU
item.dc:creator: KKU
item.content:encoded:
I’m unable to draw a pv.Line in Protovis:
points is a 2D array, which is working for painting pv.Dor
for (var k=0;k<points.length;k++)
{
vis.add(pv.Line)
.bottom(points[k][0])
.left(points[k][1])
.cursor("move");
}

item.title: By: Sean
item.dc:creator: Sean
item.description: Brilliant write up! Protovis desperately needs more documentation like this. My biggest complaint so far is that the Chrome JS Debugger always reports my mistakes in protovis.js ... thus, finding where I went wrong is nearly impossible and forces me into a painful trial and error mode that takes forever (almost ready to settle for FLOT). Any suggestions for dealing with this would be greatly appreciated.
item.content:encoded: Brilliant write up! Protovis desperately needs more documentation like this. My biggest complaint so far is that the Chrome JS Debugger always reports my mistakes in protovis.js … thus, finding where I went wrong is nearly impossible and forces me into a painful trial and error mode that takes forever (almost ready to settle for FLOT). Any suggestions for dealing with this would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: By: jerome
item.dc:creator: jerome
item.description: thanks, I find the the documentation quite good but what's missing are more examples and a bigger gallery, so that's my contribution :)
item.content:encoded: thanks, I find the the documentation quite good but what’s missing are more examples and a bigger gallery, so that’s my contribution ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: hlomas
item.dc:creator: hlomas
item.description: Thanks for the excellent tutorial, it likely took a while to write all this up but it is a wonderful guide and fills a lot of holes in the official documentation.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the excellent tutorial, it likely took a while to write all this up but it is a wonderful guide and fills a lot of holes in the official documentation.
